quote: The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel:
author: Solomon

quote: to know wisdom and instruction; to discern the words of understanding;
author: Solomon

quote: to receive instruction in wise dealing, in righteousness, justice, and equity;
author: Solomon

quote: to give prudence to the simple, knowledge and discretion to the young man:
author: Solomon

quote: that the wise man may hear, and increase in learning; that the man of understanding may attain to sound counsel:
author: Solomon

quote: to understand a proverb, and parables, the words and riddles of the wise.
author: Solomon

quote: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge; but the foolish despise wisdom and instruction.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, listen to your father's instruction, and don't forsake your mother's teaching:
author: Solomon

quote: for they will be a garland to grace your head, and chains around your neck.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, if sinners entice you, don't consent.
author: Solomon

quote: If they say, |Come with us, Let's lay in wait for blood; let's lurk secretly for the innocent without cause;
author: Solomon

quote: let's swallow them up alive like Sheol, and whole, like those who go down into the pit.
author: Solomon

quote: We'll find all valuable wealth. We'll fill our houses with spoil.
author: Solomon

quote: You shall cast your lot among us. We'll all have one purse.|
author: Solomon

quote: My son, don't walk in the way with them. Keep your foot from their path,
author: Solomon

quote: for their feet run to evil. They hurry to shed blood.
author: Solomon

quote: For in vain is the net spread in the sight of any bird:
author: Solomon

quote: but these lay wait for their own blood. They lurk secretly for their own lives.
author: Solomon

quote: So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain. It takes away the life of its owners.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom calls aloud in the street. She utters her voice in the public squares.
author: Solomon

quote: She calls at the head of noisy places. At the entrance of the city gates, she utters her words:
author: Solomon

quote: |How long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity? How long will mockers delight themselves in mockery, and fools hate knowledge?
author: Solomon

quote: Turn at my reproof. Behold, I will pour out my spirit on you. I will make known my words to you.
author: Solomon

quote: Because I have called, and you have refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no one has paid attention;
author: Solomon

quote: but you have ignored all my counsel, and wanted none of my reproof;
author: Solomon

quote: I also will laugh at your disaster. I will mock when calamity overtakes you;
author: Solomon

quote: when calamity overtakes you like a storm, when your disaster comes on like a whirlwind; when distress and anguish come on you.
author: Solomon

quote: Then will they call on me, but I will not answer. They will seek me diligently, but they will not find me;
author: Solomon

quote: because they hated knowledge, and didn't choose the fear of Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: They wanted none of my counsel. They despised all my reproof.
author: Solomon

quote: Therefore they will eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own schemes.
author: Solomon

quote: For the backsliding of the simple will kill them. The careless ease of fools will destroy them.
author: Solomon

quote: But whoever listens to me will dwell securely, and will be at ease, without fear of harm.|
author: Solomon

quote: My son, if you will receive my words, and store up my commandments within you;
author: Solomon

quote: So as to turn your ear to wisdom, and apply your heart to understanding;
author: Solomon

quote: Yes, if you call out for discernment, and lift up your voice for understanding;
author: Solomon

quote: If you seek her as silver, and search for her as for hidden treasures:
author: Solomon

quote: then you will understand the fear of Yahweh, and find the knowledge of God.
author: Solomon

quote: For Yahweh gives wisdom. Out of his mouth comes knowledge and understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: He lays up sound wisdom for the upright. He is a shield to those who walk in integrity;
author: Solomon

quote: that he may guard the paths of justice, and preserve the way of his saints.
author: Solomon

quote: Then you will understand righteousness and justice, equity and every good path.
author: Solomon

quote: For wisdom will enter into your heart. Knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.
author: Solomon

quote: Discretion will watch over you. Understanding will keep you,
author: Solomon

quote: to deliver you from the way of evil, from the men who speak perverse things;
author: Solomon

quote: who forsake the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
author: Solomon

quote: who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the perverseness of evil;
author: Solomon

quote: who are crooked in their ways, and wayward in their paths:
author: Solomon

quote: To deliver you from the strange woman, even from the foreigner who flatters with her words;
author: Solomon

quote: who forsakes the friend of her youth, and forgets the covenant of her God:
author: Solomon

quote: for her house leads down to death, her paths to the dead.
author: Solomon

quote: None who go to her return again, neither do they attain to the paths of life:
author: Solomon

quote: that you may walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
author: Solomon

quote: For the upright will dwell in the land. The perfect will remain in it.
author: Solomon

quote: But the wicked will be cut off from the land. The treacherous will be rooted out of it.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, don't forget my teaching; but let your heart keep my commandments:
author: Solomon

quote: for length of days, and years of life, and peace, will they add to you.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't let kindness and truth forsake you. Bind them around your neck. Write them on the tablet of your heart.
author: Solomon

quote: So you will find favor, and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
author: Solomon

quote: Trust in Yahweh with all your heart, and don't lean on your own understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be wise in your own eyes. Fear Yahweh, and depart from evil.
author: Solomon

quote: It will be health to your body, and nourishment to your bones.
author: Solomon

quote: Honor Yahweh with your substance, with the first fruits of all your increase:
author: Solomon

quote: so your barns will be filled with plenty, and your vats will overflow with new wine.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, don't despise Yahweh's discipline, neither be weary of his reproof:
author: Solomon

quote: for whom Yahweh loves, he reproves; even as a father reproves the son in whom he delights.
author: Solomon

quote: Happy is the man who finds wisdom, the man who gets understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: For her good profit is better than getting silver, and her return is better than fine gold.
author: Solomon

quote: She is more precious than rubies. None of the things you can desire are to be compared to her.
author: Solomon

quote: Length of days is in her right hand. In her left hand are riches and honor.
author: Solomon

quote: Her ways are ways of pleasantness. All her paths are peace.
author: Solomon

quote: She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her. Happy is everyone who retains her.
author: Solomon

quote: By wisdom Yahweh founded the earth. By understanding, he established the heavens.
author: Solomon

quote: By his knowledge, the depths were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, let them not depart from your eyes. Keep sound wisdom and discretion:
author: Solomon

quote: so they will be life to your soul, and grace for your neck.
author: Solomon

quote: Then you shall walk in your way securely. Your foot won't stumble.
author: Solomon

quote: When you lie down, you will not be afraid. Yes, you will lie down, and your sleep will be sweet.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it comes:
author: Solomon

quote: for Yahweh will be your confidence, and will keep your foot from being taken.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do it.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't say to your neighbor, |Go, and come again; tomorrow I will give it to you,| when you have it by you.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't devise evil against your neighbor, since he dwells securely by you.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't strive with a man without cause, if he has done you no harm.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't envy the man of violence. Choose none of his ways.
author: Solomon

quote: For the perverse is an abomination to Yahweh, but his friendship is with the upright.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh's curse is in the house of the wicked, but he blesses the habitation of the righteous.
author: Solomon

quote: Surely he mocks the mockers, but he gives grace to the humble.
author: Solomon

quote: The wise will inherit glory, but shame will be the promotion of fools.
author: Solomon

quote: Listen, sons, to a father's instruction. Pay attention and know understanding;
author: Solomon

quote: for I give you sound learning. Don't forsake my law.
author: Solomon

quote: For I was a son to my father, tender and an only child in the sight of my mother.
author: Solomon

quote: He taught me, and said to me: |Let your heart retain my words. Keep my commandments, and live.
author: Solomon

quote: Get wisdom. Get understanding. Don't forget, neither swerve from the words of my mouth.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't forsake her, and she will preserve you. Love her, and she will keep you.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom is supreme. Get wisdom. Yes, though it costs all your possessions, get understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: Esteem her, and she will exalt you. She will bring you to honor, when you embrace her.
author: Solomon

quote: She will give to your head a garland of grace. She will deliver a crown of splendor to you.|
author: Solomon

quote: Listen, my son, and receive my sayings. The years of your life will be many.
author: Solomon

quote: I have taught you in the way of wisdom. I have led you in straight paths.
author: Solomon

quote: When you go, your steps will not be hampered. When you run, you will not stumble.
author: Solomon

quote: Take firm hold of instruction. Don't let her go. Keep her, for she is your life.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't enter into the path of the wicked. Don't walk in the way of evil men.
author: Solomon

quote: Avoid it, and don't pass by it. Turn from it, and pass on.
author: Solomon

quote: For they don't sleep, unless they do evil. Their sleep is taken away, unless they make someone fall.
author: Solomon

quote: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
author: Solomon

quote: But the path of the righteous is like the dawning light, that shines more and more until the perfect day.
author: Solomon

quote: The way of the wicked is like darkness. They don't know what they stumble over.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, attend to my words. Turn your ear to my sayings.
author: Solomon

quote: Let them not depart from your eyes. Keep them in the midst of your heart.
author: Solomon

quote: For they are life to those who find them, and health to their whole body.
author: Solomon

quote: Keep your heart with all diligence, for out of it is the wellspring of life.
author: Solomon

quote: Put away from yourself a perverse mouth. Put corrupt lips far from you.
author: Solomon

quote: Let your eyes look straight ahead. Fix your gaze directly before you.
author: Solomon

quote: Make the path of your feet level. Let all of your ways be established.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't turn to the right hand nor to the left. Remove your foot from evil.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, pay attention to my wisdom. Turn your ear to my understanding:
author: Solomon

quote: that you may maintain discretion, that your lips may preserve knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: For the lips of an adulteress drip honey. Her mouth is smoother than oil,
author: Solomon

quote: But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, and as sharp as a two-edged sword.
author: Solomon

quote: Her feet go down to death. Her steps lead straight to Sheol.
author: Solomon

quote: She gives no thought to the way of life. Her ways are crooked, and she doesn't know it.
author: Solomon

quote: Now therefore, my sons, listen to me. Don't depart from the words of my mouth.
author: Solomon

quote: Remove your way far from her. Don't come near the door of her house,
author: Solomon

quote: lest you give your honor to others, and your years to the cruel one;
author: Solomon

quote: lest strangers feast on your wealth, and your labors enrich another man's house.
author: Solomon

quote: You will groan at your latter end, when your flesh and your body are consumed,
author: Solomon

quote: and say, |How I have hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
author: Solomon

quote: neither have I obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor turned my ear to those who instructed me!
author: Solomon

quote: I have come to the brink of utter ruin, in the midst of the gathered assembly.|
author: Solomon

quote: Drink water out of your own cistern, running water out of your own well.
author: Solomon

quote: Should your springs overflow in the streets, streams of water in the public squares?
author: Solomon

quote: Let them be for yourself alone, not for strangers with you.
author: Solomon

quote: Let your spring be blessed. Rejoice in the wife of your youth.
author: Solomon

quote: A loving doe and a graceful deer— let her breasts satisfy you at all times. Be captivated always with her love.
author: Solomon

quote: For why should you, my son, be captivated with an adulteress? Why embrace the bosom of another?
author: Solomon

quote: For the ways of man are before the eyes of Yahweh. He examines all his paths.
author: Solomon

quote: The evil deeds of the wicked ensnare him. The cords of his sin hold him firmly.
author: Solomon

quote: He will die for lack of instruction. In the greatness of his folly, he will go astray.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, if you have become collateral for your neighbor, if you have struck your hands in pledge for a stranger;
author: Solomon

quote: You are trapped by the words of your mouth. You are ensnared with the words of your mouth.
author: Solomon

quote: Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself, since you have come into the hand of your neighbor. Go, humble yourself. Press your plea with your neighbor.
author: Solomon

quote: Give no sleep to your eyes, nor slumber to your eyelids.
author: Solomon

quote: Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the snare of the fowler.
author: Solomon

quote: Go to the ant, you sluggard. Consider her ways, and be wise;
author: Solomon

quote: which having no chief, overseer, or ruler,
author: Solomon

quote: provides her bread in the summer, and gathers her food in the harvest.
author: Solomon

quote: How long will you sleep, sluggard? When will you arise out of your sleep?
author: Solomon

quote: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
author: Solomon

quote: so your poverty will come as a robber, and your scarcity as an armed man.
author: Solomon

quote: A worthless person, a man of iniquity, is he who walks with a perverse mouth;
author: Solomon

quote: who winks with his eyes, who signals with his feet, who motions with his fingers;
author: Solomon

quote: in whose heart is perverseness, who devises evil continually, who always sows discord.
author: Solomon

quote: Therefore his calamity will come suddenly. He will be broken suddenly, and that without remedy.
author: Solomon

quote: There are six things which Yahweh hates; yes, seven which are an abomination to him:
author: Solomon

quote: haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood;
author: Solomon

quote: a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are swift in running to mischief,
author: Solomon

quote: a false witness who utters lies, and he who sows discord among brothers.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, keep your father's commandment, and don't forsake your mother's teaching.
author: Solomon

quote: Bind them continually on your heart. Tie them around your neck.
author: Solomon

quote: When you walk, it will lead you. When you sleep, it will watch over you. When you awake, it will talk with you.
author: Solomon

quote: For the commandment is a lamp, and the law is light. Reproofs of instruction are the way of life,
author: Solomon

quote: to keep you from the immoral woman, from the flattery of the wayward wife's tongue.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't lust after her beauty in your heart, neither let her captivate you with her eyelids.
author: Solomon

quote: For a prostitute reduces you to a piece of bread. The adulteress hunts for your precious life.
author: Solomon

quote: Can a man scoop fire into his lap, and his clothes not be burned?
author: Solomon

quote: Or can one walk on hot coals, and his feet not be scorched?
author: Solomon

quote: So is he who goes in to his neighbor's wife. Whoever touches her will not be unpunished.
author: Solomon

quote: Men don't despise a thief, if he steals to satisfy himself when he is hungry:
author: Solomon

quote: but if he is found, he shall restore seven times. He shall give all the wealth of his house.
author: Solomon

quote: He who commits adultery with a woman is void of understanding. He who does it destroys his own soul.
author: Solomon

quote: He will get wounds and dishonor. His reproach will not be wiped away.
author: Solomon

quote: For jealousy arouses the fury of the husband. He won't spare in the day of vengeance.
author: Solomon

quote: He won't regard any ransom, neither will he rest content, though you give many gifts.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, keep my words. Lay up my commandments within you.
author: Solomon

quote: Keep my commandments and live! Guard my teaching as the apple of your eye.
author: Solomon

quote: Bind them on your fingers. Write them on the tablet of your heart.
author: Solomon

quote: Tell wisdom, |You are my sister.| Call understanding your relative,
author: Solomon

quote: that they may keep you from the strange woman, from the foreigner who flatters with her words.
author: Solomon

quote: For at the window of my house, I looked out through my lattice.
author: Solomon

quote: I saw among the simple ones. I discerned among the youths a young man void of understanding,
author: Solomon

quote: passing through the street near her corner, he went the way to her house,
author: Solomon

quote: in the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the middle of the night and in the darkness.
author: Solomon

quote: Behold, there a woman met him with the attire of a prostitute, and with crafty intent.
author: Solomon

quote: She is loud and defiant. Her feet don't stay in her house.
author: Solomon

quote: Now she is in the streets, now in the squares, and lurking at every corner.
author: Solomon

quote: So she caught him, and kissed him. With an impudent face she said to him:
author: Solomon

quote: |Sacrifices of peace offerings are with me. This day I have paid my vows.
author: Solomon

quote: Therefore I came out to meet you, to diligently seek your face, and I have found you.
author: Solomon

quote: I have spread my couch with carpets of tapestry, with striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.
author: Solomon

quote: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
author: Solomon

quote: Come, let's take our fill of loving until the morning. Let's solace ourselves with loving.
author: Solomon

quote: For my husband isn't at home. He has gone on a long journey.
author: Solomon

quote: He has taken a bag of money with him. He will come home at the full moon.|
author: Solomon

quote: With persuasive words, she led him astray. With the flattering of her lips, she seduced him.
author: Solomon

quote: He followed her immediately, as an ox goes to the slaughter, as a fool stepping into a noose.
author: Solomon

quote: Until an arrow strikes through his liver, as a bird hurries to the snare, and doesn't know that it will cost his life.
author: Solomon

quote: Now therefore, sons, listen to me. Pay attention to the words of my mouth.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't let your heart turn to her ways. Don't go astray in her paths,
author: Solomon

quote: for she has thrown down many wounded. Yes, all her slain are a mighty army.
author: Solomon

quote: Her house is the way to Sheol, going down to the rooms of death.
author: Solomon

quote: Doesn't wisdom cry out? Doesn't understanding raise her voice?
author: Solomon

quote: On the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she stands.
author: Solomon

quote: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the entry doors, she cries aloud:
author: Solomon

quote: |To you men, I call! I send my voice to the sons of mankind.
author: Solomon

quote: You simple, understand prudence. You fools, be of an understanding heart.
author: Solomon

quote: Hear, for I will speak excellent things. The opening of my lips is for right things.
author: Solomon

quote: For my mouth speaks truth. Wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
author: Solomon

quote: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness. There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.
author: Solomon

quote: They are all plain to him who understands, right to those who find knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: Receive my instruction rather than silver; knowledge rather than choice gold.
author: Solomon

quote: For wisdom is better than rubies. All the things that may be desired can't be compared to it.
author: Solomon

quote: |I, wisdom, have made prudence my dwelling. Find out knowledge and discretion.
author: Solomon

quote: The fear of Yahweh is to hate evil. I hate pride, arrogance, the evil way, and the perverse mouth.
author: Solomon

quote: Counsel and sound knowledge are mine. I have understanding and power.
author: Solomon

quote: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
author: Solomon

quote: By me princes rule; nobles, and all the righteous rulers of the earth.
author: Solomon

quote: I love those who love me. Those who seek me diligently will find me.
author: Solomon

quote: With me are riches, honor, enduring wealth, and prosperity.
author: Solomon

quote: My fruit is better than gold, yes, than fine gold; my yield than choice silver.
author: Solomon

quote: I walk in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of justice;
author: Solomon

quote: That I may give wealth to those who love me. I fill their treasuries.
author: Solomon

quote: |Yahweh possessed me in the beginning of his work, before his deeds of old.
author: Solomon

quote: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, before the earth existed.
author: Solomon

quote: When there were no depths, I was brought forth, when there were no springs abounding with water.
author: Solomon

quote: Before the mountains were settled in place, before the hills, I was brought forth;
author: Solomon

quote: while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.
author: Solomon

quote: When he established the heavens, I was there; when he set a circle on the surface of the deep,
author: Solomon

quote: when he established the clouds above, when the springs of the deep became strong,
author: Solomon

quote: when he gave to the sea its boundary, that the waters should not violate his commandment, when he marked out the foundations of the earth;
author: Solomon

quote: then I was the craftsman by his side. I was a delight day by day, always rejoicing before him,
author: Solomon

quote: Rejoicing in his whole world. My delight was with the sons of men.
author: Solomon

quote: |Now therefore, my sons, listen to me, for blessed are those who keep my ways.
author: Solomon

quote: Hear instruction, and be wise. Don't refuse it.
author: Solomon

quote: Blessed is the man who hears me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at my door posts.
author: Solomon

quote: For whoever finds me, finds life, and will obtain favor from Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul. All those who hate me love death.|
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom has built her house. She has carved out her seven pillars.
author: Solomon

quote: She has prepared her meat. She has mixed her wine. She has also set her table.
author: Solomon

quote: She has sent out her maidens. She cries from the highest places of the city:
author: Solomon

quote: |Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!| As for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,
author: Solomon

quote: |Come, eat some of my bread, Drink some of the wine which I have mixed!
author: Solomon

quote: Leave your simple ways, and live. Walk in the way of understanding.|
author: Solomon

quote: He who corrects a mocker invites insult. He who reproves a wicked man invites abuse.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't reprove a scoffer, lest he hate you. Reprove a wise man, and he will love you.
author: Solomon

quote: Instruct a wise man, and he will be still wiser. Teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.
author: Solomon

quote: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom. The knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: For by me your days will be multiplied. The years of your life will be increased.
author: Solomon

quote: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself. If you mock, you alone will bear it.
author: Solomon

quote: The foolish woman is loud, Undisciplined, and knows nothing.
author: Solomon

quote: She sits at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
author: Solomon

quote: To call to those who pass by, who go straight on their ways,
author: Solomon

quote: |Whoever is simple, let him turn in here.| as for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,
author: Solomon

quote: |Stolen water is sweet. Food eaten in secret is pleasant.|
author: Solomon

quote: But he doesn't know that the dead are there, that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
author: Solomon

quote: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes a glad father; but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.
author: Solomon

quote: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing, but righteousness delivers from death.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh will not allow the soul of the righteous to go hungry, but he thrusts away the desire of the wicked.
author: Solomon

quote: He becomes poor who works with a lazy hand, but the hand of the diligent brings wealth.
author: Solomon

quote: He who gathers in summer is a wise son, but he who sleeps during the harvest is a son who causes shame.
author: Solomon

quote: Blessings are on the head of the righteous, but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
author: Solomon

quote: The memory of the righteous is blessed, but the name of the wicked will rot.
author: Solomon

quote: The wise in heart accept commandments, but a chattering fool will fall.
author: Solomon

quote: He who walks blamelessly walks surely, but he who perverts his ways will be found out.
author: Solomon

quote: One winking with the eye causes sorrow, but a chattering fool will fall.
author: Solomon

quote: The mouth of the righteous is a spring of life, but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
author: Solomon

quote: Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all wrongs.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom is found on the lips of him who has discernment, but a rod is for the back of him who is void of understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: Wise men lay up knowledge, but the mouth of the foolish is near ruin.
author: Solomon

quote: The rich man's wealth is his strong city. The destruction of the poor is their poverty.
author: Solomon

quote: The labor of the righteous leads to life. The increase of the wicked leads to sin.
author: Solomon

quote: He is in the way of life who heeds correction, but he who forsakes reproof leads others astray.
author: Solomon

quote: He who hides hatred has lying lips. He who utters a slander is a fool.
author: Solomon

quote: In the multitude of words there is no lack of disobedience, but he who restrains his lips does wisely.
author: Solomon

quote: The tongue of the righteous is like choice silver. The heart of the wicked is of little worth.
author: Solomon

quote: The lips of the righteous feed many, but the foolish die for lack of understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh's blessing brings wealth, and he adds no trouble to it.
author: Solomon

quote: It is a fool's pleasure to do wickedness, but wisdom is a man of understanding's pleasure.
author: Solomon

quote: What the wicked fear, will overtake them, but the desire of the righteous will be granted.
author: Solomon

quote: When the whirlwind passes, the wicked is no more; but the righteous stand firm forever.
author: Solomon

quote: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to those who send him.
author: Solomon

quote: The fear of Yahweh prolongs days, but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
author: Solomon

quote: The prospect of the righteous is joy, but the hope of the wicked will perish.
author: Solomon

quote: The way of Yahweh is a stronghold to the upright, but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.
author: Solomon

quote: The righteous will never be removed, but the wicked will not dwell in the land.
author: Solomon

quote: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut off.
author: Solomon

quote: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, but the mouth of the wicked is perverse.
author: Solomon

quote: A false balance is an abomination to Yahweh, but accurate weights are his delight.
author: Solomon

quote: When pride comes, then comes shame, but with humility comes wisdom.
author: Solomon

quote: The integrity of the upright shall guide them, but the perverseness of the treacherous shall destroy them.
author: Solomon

quote: Riches don't profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death.
author: Solomon

quote: The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way, but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
author: Solomon

quote: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them, but the unfaithful will be trapped by evil desires.
author: Solomon

quote: When a wicked man dies, hope perishes, and expectation of power comes to nothing.
author: Solomon

quote: A righteous person is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked takes his place.
author: Solomon

quote: With his mouth the godless man destroys his neighbor, but the righteous will be delivered through knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices. When the wicked perish, there is shouting.
author: Solomon

quote: By the blessing of the upright, the city is exalted, but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
author: Solomon

quote: One who despises his neighbor is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding holds his peace.
author: Solomon

quote: One who brings gossip betrays a confidence, but one who is of a trustworthy spirit is one who keeps a secret.
author: Solomon

quote: Where there is no wise guidance, the nation falls, but in the multitude of counselors there is victory.
author: Solomon

quote: He who is collateral for a stranger will suffer for it, but he who refuses pledges of collateral is secure.
author: Solomon

quote: A gracious woman obtains honor, but violent men obtain riches.
author: Solomon

quote: The merciful man does good to his own soul, but he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.
author: Solomon

quote: Wicked people earn deceitful wages, but one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.
author: Solomon

quote: He who is truly righteous gets life. He who pursues evil gets death.
author: Solomon

quote: Those who are perverse in heart are an abomination to Yahweh, but those whose ways are blameless are his delight.
author: Solomon

quote: Most certainly, the evil man will not be unpunished, but the seed of the righteous will be delivered.
author: Solomon

quote: Like a gold ring in a pig's snout, is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.
author: Solomon

quote: The desire of the righteous is only good. The expectation of the wicked is wrath.
author: Solomon

quote: There is one who scatters, and increases yet more. There is one who withholds more than is appropriate, but gains poverty.
author: Solomon

quote: The liberal soul shall be made fat. He who waters shall be watered also himself.
author: Solomon

quote: People curse someone who withholds grain, but blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.
author: Solomon

quote: He who diligently seeks good seeks favor, but he who searches after evil, it shall come to him.
author: Solomon

quote: He who trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous shall flourish as the green leaf.
author: Solomon

quote: He who troubles his own house shall inherit the wind. The foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.
author: Solomon

quote: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life. He who is wise wins souls.
author: Solomon

quote: Behold, the righteous shall be repaid in the earth; how much more the wicked and the sinner!
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever loves correction loves knowledge, but he who hates reproof is stupid.
author: Solomon

quote: A good man shall obtain favor from Yahweh, but he will condemn a man of wicked devices.
author: Solomon

quote: A man shall not be established by wickedness, but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
author: Solomon

quote: A worthy woman is the crown of her husband, but a disgraceful wife is as rottenness in his bones.
author: Solomon

quote: The thoughts of the righteous are just, but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.
author: Solomon

quote: The words of the wicked are about lying in wait for blood, but the speech of the upright rescues them.
author: Solomon

quote: The wicked are overthrown, and are no more, but the house of the righteous shall stand.
author: Solomon

quote: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom, but he who has a warped mind shall be despised.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is he who is lightly esteemed, and has a servant, than he who honors himself, and lacks bread.
author: Solomon

quote: A righteous man respects the life of his animal, but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
author: Solomon

quote: He who tills his land shall have plenty of bread, but he who chases fantasies is void of understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: The wicked desires the plunder of evil men, but the root of the righteous flourishes.
author: Solomon

quote: An evil man is trapped by sinfulness of lips, but the righteous shall come out of trouble.
author: Solomon

quote: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth. The work of a man's hands shall be rewarded to him.
author: Solomon

quote: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but he who is wise listens to counsel.
author: Solomon

quote: A fool shows his annoyance the same day, but one who overlooks an insult is prudent.
author: Solomon

quote: He who is truthful testifies honestly, but a false witness lies.
author: Solomon

quote: There is one who speaks rashly like the piercing of a sword, but the tongue of the wise heals.
author: Solomon

quote: Truth's lips will be established forever, but a lying tongue is only momentary.
author: Solomon

quote: Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil, but joy comes to the promoters of peace.
author: Solomon

quote: No mischief shall happen to the righteous, but the wicked shall be filled with evil.
author: Solomon

quote: Lying lips are an abomination to Yahweh, but those who do the truth are his delight.
author: Solomon

quote: A prudent man keeps his knowledge, but the hearts of fools proclaim foolishness.
author: Solomon

quote: The hands of the diligent ones shall rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.
author: Solomon

quote: Anxiety in a man's heart weighs it down, but a kind word makes it glad.
author: Solomon

quote: A righteous person is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
author: Solomon

quote: The slothful man doesn't roast his game, but the possessions of diligent men are prized.
author: Solomon

quote: In the way of righteousness is life; in its path there is no death.
author: Solomon

quote: A wise son listens to his father's instruction, but a scoffer doesn't listen to rebuke.
author: Solomon

quote: By the fruit of his lips, a man enjoys good things; but the unfaithful crave violence.
author: Solomon

quote: He who guards his mouth guards his soul. One who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.
author: Solomon

quote: The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing, but the desire of the diligent shall be fully satisfied.
author: Solomon

quote: A righteous man hates lies, but a wicked man brings shame and disgrace.
author: Solomon

quote: Righteousness guards the way of integrity, but wickedness overthrows the sinner.
author: Solomon

quote: There are some who pretend to be rich, yet have nothing. There are some who pretend to be poor, yet have great wealth.
author: Solomon

quote: The ransom of a man's life is his riches, but the poor hear no threats.
author: Solomon

quote: The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out.
author: Solomon

quote: Pride only breeds quarrels, but with ones who take advice is wisdom.
author: Solomon

quote: Wealth gained dishonestly dwindles away, but he who gathers by hand makes it grow.
author: Solomon

quote: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but when longing is fulfilled, it is a tree of life.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever despises instruction will pay for it, but he who respects a command will be rewarded.
author: Solomon

quote: The teaching of the wise is a spring of life, to turn from the snares of death.
author: Solomon

quote: Good understanding wins favor; but the way of the unfaithful is hard.
author: Solomon

quote: Every prudent man acts from knowledge, but a fool exposes folly.
author: Solomon

quote: A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy envoy gains healing.
author: Solomon

quote: Poverty and shame come to him who refuses discipline, but he who heeds correction shall be honored.
author: Solomon

quote: Longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but fools detest turning from evil.
author: Solomon

quote: One who walks with wise men grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.
author: Solomon

quote: Misfortune pursues sinners, but prosperity rewards the righteous.
author: Solomon

quote: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children's children, but the wealth of the sinner is stored for the righteous.
author: Solomon

quote: An abundance of food is in poor people's fields, but injustice sweeps it away.
author: Solomon

quote: One who spares the rod hates his son, but one who loves him is careful to discipline him.
author: Solomon

quote: The righteous one eats to the satisfying of his soul, but the belly of the wicked goes hungry.
author: Solomon

quote: Every wise woman builds her house, but the foolish one tears it down with her own hands.
author: Solomon

quote: He who walks in his uprightness fears Yahweh, but he who is perverse in his ways despises him.
author: Solomon

quote: The fool's talk brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.
author: Solomon

quote: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean, but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
author: Solomon

quote: A truthful witness will not lie, but a false witness pours out lies.
author: Solomon

quote: A scoffer seeks wisdom, and doesn't find it, but knowledge comes easily to a discerning person.
author: Solomon

quote: Stay away from a foolish man, for you won't find knowledge on his lips.
author: Solomon

quote: The wisdom of the prudent is to think about his way, but the folly of fools is deceit.
author: Solomon

quote: Fools mock at making atonement for sins, but among the upright there is good will.
author: Solomon

quote: The heart knows its own bitterness and joy; he will not share these with a stranger.
author: Solomon

quote: The house of the wicked will be overthrown, but the tent of the upright will flourish.
author: Solomon

quote: There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.
author: Solomon

quote: Even in laughter the heart may be sorrowful, and mirth may end in heaviness.
author: Solomon

quote: The unfaithful will be repaid for his own ways; likewise a good man will be rewarded for his ways.
author: Solomon

quote: A simple man believes everything, but the prudent man carefully considers his ways.
author: Solomon

quote: A wise man fears, and shuns evil, but the fool is hotheaded and reckless.
author: Solomon

quote: He who is quick to become angry will commit folly, and a crafty man is hated.
author: Solomon

quote: The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: The evil bow down before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
author: Solomon

quote: The poor person is shunned even by his own neighbor, but the rich person has many friends.
author: Solomon

quote: He who despises his neighbor sins, but blessed is he who has pity on the poor.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't they go astray who plot evil? But love and faithfulness belong to those who plan good.
author: Solomon

quote: In all hard work there is profit, but the talk of the lips leads only to poverty.
author: Solomon

quote: The crown of the wise is their riches, but the folly of fools crowns them with folly.
author: Solomon

quote: A truthful witness saves souls, but a false witness is deceitful.
author: Solomon

quote: In the fear of Yahweh is a secure fortress, and he will be a refuge for his children.
author: Solomon

quote: The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life, turning people from the snares of death.
author: Solomon

quote: In the multitude of people is the king's glory, but in the lack of people is the destruction of the prince.
author: Solomon

quote: He who is slow to anger has great understanding, but he who has a quick temper displays folly.
author: Solomon

quote: The life of the body is a heart at peace, but envy rots the bones.
author: Solomon

quote: He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for his Maker, but he who is kind to the needy honors him.
author: Solomon

quote: The wicked is brought down in his calamity, but in death, the righteous has a refuge.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom rests in the heart of one who has understanding, and is even made known in the inward part of fools.
author: Solomon

quote: Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.
author: Solomon

quote: The king's favor is toward a servant who deals wisely, but his wrath is toward one who causes shame.
author: Solomon

quote: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
author: Solomon

quote: The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of fools gush out folly.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh's eyes are everywhere, keeping watch on the evil and the good.
author: Solomon

quote: A gentle tongue is a tree of life, but deceit in it crushes the spirit.
author: Solomon

quote: A fool despises his father's correction, but he who heeds reproof shows prudence.
author: Solomon

quote: In the house of the righteous is much treasure, but the income of the wicked brings trouble.
author: Solomon

quote: The lips of the wise spread knowledge; not so with the heart of fools.
author: Solomon

quote: The sacrifice made by the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
author: Solomon

quote: The way of the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, but he loves him who follows after righteousness.
author: Solomon

quote: There is stern discipline for one who forsakes the way: whoever hates reproof shall die.
author: Solomon

quote: Sheol and Abaddon are before Yahweh— how much more then the hearts of the children of men!
author: Solomon

quote: A scoffer doesn't love to be reproved; he will not go to the wise.
author: Solomon

quote: A glad heart makes a cheerful face; but an aching heart breaks the spirit.
author: Solomon

quote: The heart of one who has understanding seeks knowledge, but the mouths of fools feed on folly.
author: Solomon

quote: All the days of the afflicted are wretched, but one who has a cheerful heart enjoys a continual feast.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is little, with the fear of Yahweh, than great treasure with trouble.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is a dinner of herbs, where love is, than a fattened calf with hatred.
author: Solomon

quote: A wrathful man stirs up contention, but one who is slow to anger appeases strife.
author: Solomon

quote: The way of the sluggard is like a thorn patch, but the path of the upright is a highway.
author: Solomon

quote: A wise son makes a father glad, but a foolish man despises his mother.
author: Solomon

quote: Folly is joy to one who is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding keeps his way straight.
author: Solomon

quote: Where there is no counsel, plans fail; but in a multitude of counselors they are established.
author: Solomon

quote: Joy comes to a man with the reply of his mouth. How good is a word at the right time!
author: Solomon

quote: The path of life leads upward for the wise, to keep him from going downward to Sheol.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh will uproot the house of the proud, but he will keep the widow's borders intact.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh detests the thoughts of the wicked, but the thoughts of the pure are pleasing.
author: Solomon

quote: He who is greedy for gain troubles his own house, but he who hates bribes will live.
author: Solomon

quote: The heart of the righteous weighs answers, but the mouth of the wicked gushes out evil.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh is far from the wicked, but he hears the prayer of the righteous.
author: Solomon

quote: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart. Good news gives health to the bones.
author: Solomon

quote: The ear that listens to reproof lives, and will be at home among the wise.
author: Solomon

quote: He who refuses correction despises his own soul, but he who listens to reproof gets understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom. Before honor is humility.
author: Solomon

quote: The plans of the heart belong to man, but the answer of the tongue is from Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but Yahweh weighs the motives.
author: Solomon

quote: Commit your deeds to Yahweh, and your plans shall succeed.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh has made everything for its own end— yes, even the wicked for the day of evil.
author: Solomon

quote: Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to Yahweh: they shall certainly not be unpunished.
author: Solomon

quote: By mercy and truth iniquity is atoned for. By the fear of Yahweh men depart from evil.
author: Solomon

quote: When a man's ways please Yahweh, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is a little with righteousness, than great revenues with injustice.
author: Solomon

quote: A man's heart plans his course, but Yahweh directs his steps.
author: Solomon

quote: Inspired judgments are on the lips of the king. He shall not betray his mouth.
author: Solomon

quote: Honest balances and scales are Yahweh's; all the weights in the bag are his work.
author: Solomon

quote: It is an abomination for kings to do wrong, for the throne is established by righteousness.
author: Solomon

quote: Righteous lips are the delight of kings. They value one who speaks the truth.
author: Solomon

quote: The king's wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will pacify it.
author: Solomon

quote: In the light of the king's face is life. His favor is like a cloud of the spring rain.
author: Solomon

quote: How much better it is to get wisdom than gold! Yes, to get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.
author: Solomon

quote: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil. He who keeps his way preserves his soul.
author: Solomon

quote: Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.
author: Solomon

quote: It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor, than to divide the plunder with the proud.
author: Solomon

quote: He who heeds the Word finds prosperity. Whoever trusts in Yahweh is blessed.
author: Solomon

quote: The wise in heart shall be called prudent. Pleasantness of the lips promotes instruction.
author: Solomon

quote: Understanding is a fountain of life to one who has it, but the punishment of fools is their folly.
author: Solomon

quote: The heart of the wise instructs his mouth, and adds learning to his lips.
author: Solomon

quote: Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
author: Solomon

quote: There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.
author: Solomon

quote: The appetite of the laboring man labors for him; for his mouth urges him on.
author: Solomon

quote: A worthless man devises mischief. His speech is like a scorching fire.
author: Solomon

quote: A perverse man stirs up strife. A whisperer separates close friends.
author: Solomon

quote: A man of violence entices his neighbor, and leads him in a way that is not good.
author: Solomon

quote: One who winks his eyes to plot perversities, one who compresses his lips, is bent on evil.
author: Solomon

quote: Gray hair is a crown of glory. It is attained by a life of righteousness.
author: Solomon

quote: One who is slow to anger is better than the mighty; one who rules his spirit, than he who takes a city.
author: Solomon

quote: The lot is cast into the lap, but its every decision is from Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is a dry morsel with quietness, than a house full of feasting with strife.
author: Solomon

quote: A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who causes shame, and shall have a part in the inheritance among the brothers.
author: Solomon

quote: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold, but Yahweh tests the hearts.
author: Solomon

quote: An evildoer heeds wicked lips. A liar gives ear to a mischievous tongue.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever mocks the poor reproaches his Maker. He who is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished.
author: Solomon

quote: Children's children are the crown of old men; the glory of children are their parents.
author: Solomon

quote: Arrogant speech isn't fitting for a fool, much less do lying lips fit a prince.
author: Solomon

quote: A bribe is a precious stone in the eyes of him who gives it; wherever he turns, he prospers.
author: Solomon

quote: He who covers an offense promotes love; but he who repeats a matter separates best friends.
author: Solomon

quote: A rebuke enters deeper into one who has understanding than a hundred lashes into a fool.
author: Solomon

quote: An evil man seeks only rebellion; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
author: Solomon

quote: Let a bear robbed of her cubs meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever rewards evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
author: Solomon

quote: The beginning of strife is like breaching a dam, therefore stop contention before quarreling breaks out.
author: Solomon

quote: He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the righteous, both of them alike are an abomination to Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: Why is there money in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, since he has no understanding?
author: Solomon

quote: A friend loves at all times; and a brother is born for adversity.
author: Solomon

quote: A man void of understanding strikes hands, and becomes collateral in the presence of his neighbor.
author: Solomon

quote: He who loves disobedience loves strife. One who builds a high gate seeks destruction.
author: Solomon

quote: One who has a perverse heart doesn't find prosperity, and one who has a deceitful tongue falls into trouble.
author: Solomon

quote: He who becomes the father of a fool grieves. The father of a fool has no joy.
author: Solomon

quote: A cheerful heart makes good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
author: Solomon

quote: A wicked man receives a bribe in secret, to pervert the ways of justice.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom is before the face of one who has understanding, but the eyes of a fool wander to the ends of the earth.
author: Solomon

quote: A foolish son brings grief to his father, and bitterness to her who bore him.
author: Solomon

quote: Also to punish the righteous is not good, nor to flog officials for their integrity.
author: Solomon

quote: He who spares his words has knowledge. He who is even tempered is a man of understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: Even a fool, when he keeps silent, is counted wise. When he shuts his lips, he is thought to be discerning.
author: Solomon

quote: An unfriendly man pursues selfishness, and defies all sound judgment.
author: Solomon

quote: A fool has no delight in understanding, but only in revealing his own opinion.
author: Solomon

quote: When wickedness comes, contempt also comes, and with shame comes disgrace.
author: Solomon

quote: The words of a man's mouth are like deep waters. The fountain of wisdom is like a flowing brook.
author: Solomon

quote: To be partial to the faces of the wicked is not good, nor to deprive the innocent of justice.
author: Solomon

quote: A fool's lips come into strife, and his mouth invites beatings.
author: Solomon

quote: A fool's mouth is his destruction, and his lips are a snare to his soul.
author: Solomon

quote: The words of a gossip are like dainty morsels: they go down into a person's innermost parts.
author: Solomon

quote: One who is slack in his work is brother to him who is a master of destruction.
author: Solomon

quote: The name of Yahweh is a strong tower: the righteous run to him, and are safe.
author: Solomon

quote: The rich man's wealth is his strong city, like an unscalable wall in his own imagination.
author: Solomon

quote: Before destruction the heart of man is proud, but before honor is humility.
author: Solomon

quote: He who gives answer before he hears, that is folly and shame to him.
author: Solomon

quote: A man's spirit will sustain him in sickness, but a crushed spirit, who can bear?
author: Solomon

quote: The heart of the discerning gets knowledge. The ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: A man's gift makes room for him, and brings him before great men.
author: Solomon

quote: He who pleads his cause first seems right; until another comes and questions him.
author: Solomon

quote: The lot settles disputes, and keeps strong ones apart.
author: Solomon

quote: A brother offended is more difficult than a fortified city; and disputes are like the bars of a castle.
author: Solomon

quote: A man's stomach is filled with the fruit of his mouth. With the harvest of his lips he is satisfied.
author: Solomon

quote: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; those who love it will eat its fruit.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever finds a wife finds a good thing, and obtains favor of Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: The poor plead for mercy, but the rich answer harshly.
author: Solomon

quote: A man of many companions may be ruined, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is the poor who walks in his integrity than he who is perverse in his lips and is a fool.
author: Solomon

quote: It isn't good to have zeal without knowledge; nor being hasty with one's feet and missing the way.
author: Solomon

quote: The foolishness of man subverts his way; his heart rages against Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: Wealth adds many friends, but the poor is separated from his friend.
author: Solomon

quote: A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who pours out lies shall not go free.
author: Solomon

quote: Many will entreat the favor of a ruler, and everyone is a friend to a man who gives gifts.
author: Solomon

quote: All the relatives of the poor shun him: how much more do his friends avoid him! He pursues them with pleas, but they are gone.
author: Solomon

quote: He who gets wisdom loves his own soul. He who keeps understanding shall find good.
author: Solomon

quote: A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who utters lies shall perish.
author: Solomon

quote: Delicate living is not appropriate for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
author: Solomon

quote: The discretion of a man makes him slow to anger. It is his glory to overlook an offense.
author: Solomon

quote: The king's wrath is like the roaring of a lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass.
author: Solomon

quote: A foolish son is the calamity of his father. A wife's quarrels are a continual dripping.
author: Solomon

quote: House and riches are an inheritance from fathers, but a prudent wife is from Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep. The idle soul shall suffer hunger.
author: Solomon

quote: He who keeps the commandment keeps his soul, but he who is contemptuous in his ways shall die.
author: Solomon

quote: He who has pity on the poor lends to Yahweh; he will reward him.
author: Solomon

quote: Discipline your son, for there is hope; don't be a willing party to his death.
author: Solomon

quote: A hot-tempered man must pay the penalty, for if you rescue him, you must do it again.
author: Solomon

quote: Listen to counsel and receive instruction, that you may be wise in your latter end.
author: Solomon

quote: There are many plans in a man's heart, but Yahweh's counsel will prevail.
author: Solomon

quote: That which makes a man to be desired is his kindness. A poor man is better than a liar.
author: Solomon

quote: The fear of Yahweh leads to life, then contentment; he rests and will not be touched by trouble.
author: Solomon

quote: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
author: Solomon

quote: Flog a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence; rebuke one who has understanding, and he will gain knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: He who robs his father and drives away his mother, is a son who causes shame and brings reproach.
author: Solomon

quote: If you stop listening to instruction, my son, you will stray from the words of knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: A corrupt witness mocks justice, and the mouth of the wicked gulps down iniquity.
author: Solomon

quote: Penalties are prepared for scoffers, and beatings for the backs of fools.
author: Solomon

quote: Wine is a mocker, and beer is a brawler. Whoever is led astray by them is not wise.
author: Solomon

quote: The terror of a king is like the roaring of a lion. He who provokes him to anger forfeits his own life.
author: Solomon

quote: It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife; but every fool will be quarreling.
author: Solomon

quote: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.
author: Solomon

quote: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
author: Solomon

quote: Many men claim to be men of unfailing love, but who can find a faithful man?
author: Solomon

quote: A righteous man walks in integrity. Blessed are his children after him.
author: Solomon

quote: A king who sits on the throne of judgment scatters away all evil with his eyes.
author: Solomon

quote: Who can say, |I have made my heart pure. I am clean and without sin?|
author: Solomon

quote: Differing weights and differing measures, both of them alike are an abomination to Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: Even a child makes himself known by his doings, whether his work is pure, and whether it is right.
author: Solomon

quote: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Yahweh has made even both of them.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't love sleep, lest you come to poverty. Open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.
author: Solomon

quote: |It's no good, it's no good,| says the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasts.
author: Solomon

quote: There is gold and abundance of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a rare jewel.
author: Solomon

quote: Take the garment of one who puts up collateral for a stranger; and hold him in pledge for a wayward woman.
author: Solomon

quote: Fraudulent food is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth is filled with gravel.
author: Solomon

quote: Plans are established by advice; by wise guidance you wage war!
author: Solomon

quote: He who goes about as a tale-bearer reveals secrets; therefore don't keep company with him who opens wide his lips.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever curses his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in blackness of darkness.
author: Solomon

quote: An inheritance quickly gained at the beginning, won't be blessed in the end.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't say, |I will pay back evil.| Wait for Yahweh, and he will save you.
author: Solomon

quote: Yahweh detests differing weights, and dishonest scales are not pleasing.
author: Solomon

quote: A man's steps are from Yahweh; how then can man understand his way?
author: Solomon

quote: It is a snare to a man to make a rash dedication, then later to consider his vows.
author: Solomon

quote: A wise king winnows out the wicked, and drives the threshing wheel over them.
author: Solomon

quote: The spirit of man is Yahweh's lamp, searching all his innermost parts.
author: Solomon

quote: Love and faithfulness keep the king safe. His throne is sustained by love.
author: Solomon

quote: The glory of young men is their strength. The splendor of old men is their gray hair.
author: Solomon

quote: Wounding blows cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the innermost parts.
author: Solomon

quote: The king's heart is in Yahweh's hand like the watercourses. He turns it wherever he desires.
author: Solomon

quote: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, but Yahweh weighs the hearts.
author: Solomon

quote: To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to Yahweh than sacrifice.
author: Solomon

quote: A high look, and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, is sin.
author: Solomon

quote: The plans of the diligent surely lead to profit; and everyone who is hasty surely rushes to poverty.
author: Solomon

quote: Getting treasures by a lying tongue is a fleeting vapor for those who seek death.
author: Solomon

quote: The violence of the wicked will drive them away, because they refuse to do what is right.
author: Solomon

quote: The way of the guilty is devious, but the conduct of the innocent is upright.
author: Solomon

quote: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than to share a house with a contentious woman.
author: Solomon

quote: The soul of the wicked desires evil; his neighbor finds no mercy in his eyes.
author: Solomon

quote: When the mocker is punished, the simple gains wisdom. When the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: The Righteous One considers the house of the wicked, and brings the wicked to ruin.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever stops his ears at the cry of the poor, he will also cry out, but shall not be heard.
author: Solomon

quote: A gift in secret pacifies anger; and a bribe in the cloak, strong wrath.
author: Solomon

quote: It is joy to the righteous to do justice; but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.
author: Solomon

quote: The man who wanders out of the way of understanding shall rest in the assembly of the dead.
author: Solomon

quote: He who loves pleasure shall be a poor man. He who loves wine and oil shall not be rich.
author: Solomon

quote: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; the treacherous for the upright.
author: Solomon

quote: It is better to dwell in a desert land, than with a contentious and fretful woman.
author: Solomon

quote: There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man swallows it up.
author: Solomon

quote: He who follows after righteousness and kindness finds life, righteousness, and honor.
author: Solomon

quote: A wise man scales the city of the mighty, and brings down the strength of its confidence.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever guards his mouth and his tongue keeps his soul from troubles.
author: Solomon

quote: The proud and haughty man, |scoffer| is his name; he works in the arrogance of pride.
author: Solomon

quote: The desire of the sluggard kills him, for his hands refuse to labor.
author: Solomon

quote: There are those who covet greedily all day long; but the righteous give and don't withhold.
author: Solomon

quote: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination: how much more, when he brings it with a wicked mind!
author: Solomon

quote: A false witness will perish, and a man who listens speaks to eternity.
author: Solomon

quote: A wicked man hardens his face; but as for the upright, he establishes his ways.
author: Solomon

quote: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: The horse is prepared for the day of battle; but victory is with Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: A good name is more desirable than great riches, and loving favor is better than silver and gold.
author: Solomon

quote: The rich and the poor have this in common: Yahweh is the maker of them all.
author: Solomon

quote: A prudent man sees danger, and hides himself; but the simple pass on, and suffer for it.
author: Solomon

quote: The result of humility and the fear of Yahweh is wealth, honor, and life.
author: Solomon

quote: Thorns and snares are in the path of the wicked: whoever guards his soul stays from them.
author: Solomon

quote: Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.
author: Solomon

quote: The rich rule over the poor. The borrower is servant to the lender.
author: Solomon

quote: He who sows wickedness reaps trouble, and the rod of his fury will be destroyed.
author: Solomon

quote: He who has a generous eye will be blessed; for he shares his food with the poor.
author: Solomon

quote: Drive out the mocker, and strife will go out; yes, quarrels and insults will stop.
author: Solomon

quote: He who loves purity of heart and speaks gracefully is the king's friend.
author: Solomon

quote: The eyes of Yahweh watch over knowledge; but he frustrates the words of the unfaithful.
author: Solomon

quote: The sluggard says, |There is a lion outside! I will be killed in the streets!|
author: Solomon

quote: The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit: he who is under Yahweh's wrath will fall into it.
author: Solomon

quote: Folly is bound up in the heart of a child: the rod of discipline drives it far from him.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever oppresses the poor for his own increase and whoever gives to the rich, both come to poverty.
author: Solomon

quote: Turn your ear, and listen to the words of the wise. Apply your heart to my teaching.
author: Solomon

quote: For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you, if all of them are ready on your lips.
author: Solomon

quote: That your trust may be in Yahweh, I teach you today, even you.
author: Solomon

quote: Haven't I written to you thirty excellent things of counsel and knowledge,
author: Solomon

quote: To teach you truth, reliable words, to give sound answers to the ones who sent you?
author: Solomon

quote: Don't exploit the poor, because he is poor; and don't crush the needy in court;
author: Solomon

quote: for Yahweh will plead their case, and plunder the life of those who plunder them.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't befriend a hot-tempered man, and don't associate with one who harbors anger:
author: Solomon

quote: lest you learn his ways, and ensnare your soul.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't you be one of those who strike hands, of those who are collateral for debts.
author: Solomon

quote: If you don't have means to pay, why should he take away your bed from under you?
author: Solomon

quote: Don't move the ancient boundary stone, which your fathers have set up.
author: Solomon

quote: Do you see a man skilled in his work? He will serve kings. He won't serve obscure men.
author: Solomon

quote: When you sit to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before you;
author: Solomon

quote: put a knife to your throat, if you are a man given to appetite.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be desirous of his dainties, since they are deceitful food.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't weary yourself to be rich. In your wisdom, show restraint.
author: Solomon

quote: Why do you set your eyes on that which is not? For it certainly sprouts wings like an eagle and flies in the sky.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't eat the food of him who has a stingy eye, and don't crave his delicacies:
author: Solomon

quote: for as he thinks about the cost, so he is. |Eat and drink!| he says to you, but his heart is not with you.
author: Solomon

quote: The morsel which you have eaten you shall vomit up, and lose your good words.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't speak in the ears of a fool, for he will despise the wisdom of your words.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't move the ancient boundary stone. Don't encroach on the fields of the fatherless:
author: Solomon

quote: for their Defender is strong. He will plead their case against you.
author: Solomon

quote: Apply your heart to instruction, and your ears to the words of knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't withhold correction from a child. If you punish him with the rod, he will not die.
author: Solomon

quote: Punish him with the rod, and save his soul from Sheol.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, if your heart is wise, then my heart will be glad, even mine:
author: Solomon

quote: yes, my heart will rejoice, when your lips speak what is right.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't let your heart envy sinners; but rather fear Yahweh all the day long.
author: Solomon

quote: Indeed surely there is a future hope, and your hope will not be cut off.
author: Solomon

quote: Listen, my son, and be wise, and keep your heart on the right path!
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be among ones drinking too much wine, or those who gorge themselves on meat:
author: Solomon

quote: for the drunkard and the glutton shall become poor; and drowsiness clothes them in rags.
author: Solomon

quote: Listen to your father who gave you life, and don't despise your mother when she is old.
author: Solomon

quote: Buy the truth, and don't sell it. Get wisdom, discipline, and understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: The father of the righteous has great joy. Whoever fathers a wise child delights in him.
author: Solomon

quote: Let your father and your mother be glad! Let her who bore you rejoice!
author: Solomon

quote: My son, give me your heart; and let your eyes keep in my ways.
author: Solomon

quote: For a prostitute is a deep pit; and a wayward wife is a narrow well.
author: Solomon

quote: Yes, she lies in wait like a robber, and increases the unfaithful among men.
author: Solomon

quote: Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has strife? Who has complaints? Who has needless bruises? Who has bloodshot eyes?
author: Solomon

quote: Those who stay long at the wine; those who go to seek out mixed wine.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't look at the wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup, when it goes down smoothly.
author: Solomon

quote: In the end, it bites like a snake, and poisons like a viper.
author: Solomon

quote: Your eyes will see strange things, and your mind will imagine confusing things.
author: Solomon

quote: Yes, you will be as he who lies down in the midst of the sea, or as he who lies on top of the rigging:
author: Solomon

quote: |They hit me, and I was not hurt! They beat me, and I don't feel it! When will I wake up? I can do it again. I can find another.|
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be envious of evil men; neither desire to be with them:
author: Solomon

quote: for their hearts plot violence, and their lips talk about mischief.
author: Solomon

quote: Through wisdom a house is built; by understanding it is established;
author: Solomon

quote: by knowledge the rooms are filled with all rare and beautiful treasure.
author: Solomon

quote: A wise man has great power; and a knowledgeable man increases strength;
author: Solomon

quote: for by wise guidance you wage your war; and victory is in many advisors.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom is too high for a fool: he doesn't open his mouth in the gate.
author: Solomon

quote: One who plots to do evil will be called a schemer.
author: Solomon

quote: The schemes of folly are sin. The mocker is detested by men.
author: Solomon

quote: If you falter in the time of trouble, your strength is small.
author: Solomon

quote: Rescue those who are being led away to death! Indeed, hold back those who are staggering to the slaughter!
author: Solomon

quote: If you say, |Behold, we didn't know this;| doesn't he who weighs the hearts consider it? He who keeps your soul, doesn't he know it? Shall he not render to every man according to his work?
author: Solomon

quote: My son, eat honey, for it is good; the droppings of the honeycomb, which are sweet to your taste:
author: Solomon

quote: so you shall know wisdom to be to your soul; if you have found it, then there will be a reward, your hope will not be cut off.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't lay in wait, wicked man, against the habitation of the righteous. Don't destroy his resting place:
author: Solomon

quote: for a righteous man falls seven times, and rises up again; but the wicked are overthrown by calamity.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't rejoice when your enemy falls. Don't let your heart be glad when he is overthrown;
author: Solomon

quote: lest Yahweh see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't fret yourself because of evildoers; neither be envious of the wicked:
author: Solomon

quote: for there will be no reward to the evil man; and the lamp of the wicked shall be snuffed out.
author: Solomon

quote: My son, fear Yahweh and the king. Don't join those who are rebellious:
author: Solomon

quote: for their calamity will rise suddenly; the destruction from them both—who knows?
author: Solomon

quote: These also are sayings of the wise. To show partiality in judgment is not good.
author: Solomon

quote: He who says to the wicked, |You are righteous;| peoples shall curse him, and nations shall abhor him—
author: Solomon

quote: but it will go well with those who convict the guilty, and a rich blessing will come on them.
author: Solomon

quote: An honest answer is like a kiss on the lips.
author: Solomon

quote: Prepare your work outside, and get your fields ready. Afterwards, build your house.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be a witness against your neighbor without cause. Don't deceive with your lips.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't say, |I will do to him as he has done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.|
author: Solomon

quote: I went by the field of the sluggard, by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
author: Solomon

quote: Behold, it was all grown over with thorns. Its surface was covered with nettles, and its stone wall was broken down.
author: Solomon

quote: Then I saw, and considered well. I saw, and received instruction:
author: Solomon

quote: a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep;
author: Solomon

quote: so your poverty will come as a robber, and your want as an armed man.
author: Solomon

quote: These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
author: Solomon

quote: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing, but the glory of kings is to search out a matter.
author: Solomon

quote: As the heavens for height, and the earth for depth, so the hearts of kings are unsearchable.
author: Solomon

quote: Take away the dross from the silver, and material comes out for the refiner;
author: Solomon

quote: Take away the wicked from the king's presence, and his throne will be established in righteousness.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't exalt yourself in the presence of the king, or claim a place among great men;
author: Solomon

quote: for it is better that it be said to you, |Come up here,| than that you should be put lower in the presence of the prince, whom your eyes have seen.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be hasty in bringing charges to court. What will you do in the end when your neighbor shames you?
author: Solomon

quote: Debate your case with your neighbor, and don't betray the confidence of another;
author: Solomon

quote: lest one who hears it put you to shame, and your bad reputation never depart.
author: Solomon

quote: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.
author: Solomon

quote: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover to an obedient ear.
author: Solomon

quote: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to those who send him; for he refreshes the soul of his masters.
author: Solomon

quote: As clouds and wind without rain, so is he who boasts of gifts deceptively.
author: Solomon

quote: By patience a ruler is persuaded. A soft tongue breaks the bone.
author: Solomon

quote: Have you found honey? Eat as much as is sufficient for you, lest you eat too much, and vomit it.
author: Solomon

quote: Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor's house, lest he be weary of you, and hate you.
author: Solomon

quote: A man who gives false testimony against his neighbor is like a club, a sword, or a sharp arrow.
author: Solomon

quote: Confidence in someone unfaithful in time of trouble is like a bad tooth, or a lame foot.
author: Solomon

quote: As one who takes away a garment in cold weather, or vinegar on soda, so is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.
author: Solomon

quote: If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat. If he is thirsty, give him water to drink:
author: Solomon

quote: for you will heap coals of fire on his head, and Yahweh will reward you.
author: Solomon

quote: The north wind brings forth rain: so a backbiting tongue brings an angry face.
author: Solomon

quote: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than to share a house with a contentious woman.
author: Solomon

quote: Like cold water to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
author: Solomon

quote: Like a muddied spring, and a polluted well, so is a righteous man who gives way before the wicked.
author: Solomon

quote: It is not good to eat much honey; nor is it honorable to seek one's own honor.
author: Solomon

quote: Like a city that is broken down and without walls is a man whose spirit is without restraint.
author: Solomon

quote: Like snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honor is not fitting for a fool.
author: Solomon

quote: Like a fluttering sparrow, like a darting swallow, so the undeserved curse doesn't come to rest.
author: Solomon

quote: A whip is for the horse, a bridle for the donkey, and a rod for the back of fools!
author: Solomon

quote: Don't answer a fool according to his folly, lest you also be like him.
