author: Solomon

quote: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own eyes.
author: Solomon

quote: One who sends a message by the hand of a fool is cutting off feet and drinking violence.
author: Solomon

quote: Like the legs of the lame that hang loose: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
author: Solomon

quote: As one who binds a stone in a sling, so is he who gives honor to a fool.
author: Solomon

quote: Like a thornbush that goes into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
author: Solomon

quote: As an archer who wounds all, so is he who hires a fool or he who hires those who pass by.
author: Solomon

quote: As a dog that returns to his vomit, so is a fool who repeats his folly.
author: Solomon

quote: Do you see a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
author: Solomon

quote: The sluggard says, |There is a lion in the road! A fierce lion roams the streets!|
author: Solomon

quote: As the door turns on its hinges, so does the sluggard on his bed.
author: Solomon

quote: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish. He is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.
author: Solomon

quote: The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men who answer with discretion.
author: Solomon

quote: Like one who grabs a dog's ears is one who passes by and meddles in a quarrel not his own.
author: Solomon

quote: Like a madman who shoots torches, arrows, and death,
author: Solomon

quote: is the man who deceives his neighbor and says, |Am I not joking?|
author: Solomon

quote: For lack of wood a fire goes out. Without gossip, a quarrel dies down.
author: Solomon

quote: As coals are to hot embers, and wood to fire, so is a contentious man to kindling strife.
author: Solomon

quote: The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, they go down into the innermost parts.
author: Solomon

quote: Like silver dross on an earthen vessel are the lips of a fervent one with an evil heart.
author: Solomon

quote: A malicious man disguises himself with his lips, but he harbors evil in his heart.
author: Solomon

quote: When his speech is charming, don't believe him; for there are seven abominations in his heart.
author: Solomon

quote: His malice may be concealed by deception, but his wickedness will be exposed in the assembly.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever digs a pit shall fall into it. Whoever rolls a stone, it will come back on him.
author: Solomon

quote: A lying tongue hates those it hurts; and a flattering mouth works ruin.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't boast about tomorrow; for you don't know what a day may bring forth.
author: Solomon

quote: Let another man praise you, and not your own mouth; a stranger, and not your own lips.
author: Solomon

quote: A stone is heavy, and sand is a burden; but a fool's provocation is heavier than both.
author: Solomon

quote: Wrath is cruel, and anger is overwhelming; but who is able to stand before jealousy?
author: Solomon

quote: Better is open rebuke than hidden love.
author: Solomon

quote: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; although the kisses of an enemy are profuse.
author: Solomon

quote: A full soul loathes a honeycomb; but to a hungry soul, every bitter thing is sweet.
author: Solomon

quote: As a bird that wanders from her nest, so is a man who wanders from his home.
author: Solomon

quote: Perfume and incense bring joy to the heart; so does earnest counsel from a man's friend.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't forsake your friend and your father's friend. Don't go to your brother's house in the day of your disaster: better is a neighbor who is near than a distant brother.
author: Solomon

quote: Be wise, my son, and bring joy to my heart, then I can answer my tormentor.
author: Solomon

quote: A prudent man sees danger and takes refuge; but the simple pass on, and suffer for it.
author: Solomon

quote: Take his garment when he puts up collateral for a stranger. Hold it for a wayward woman!
author: Solomon

quote: He who blesses his neighbor with a loud voice early in the morning, it will be taken as a curse by him.
author: Solomon

quote: A continual dropping on a rainy day and a contentious wife are alike:
author: Solomon

quote: restraining her is like restraining the wind, or like grasping oil in his right hand.
author: Solomon

quote: Iron sharpens iron; so a man sharpens his friend's countenance.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever tends the fig tree shall eat its fruit. He who looks after his master shall be honored.
author: Solomon

quote: As water reflects a face, so a man's heart reflects the man.
author: Solomon

quote: Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied; and a man's eyes are never satisfied.
author: Solomon

quote: The crucible is for silver, and the furnace for gold; but man is refined by his praise.
author: Solomon

quote: Though you grind a fool in a mortar with a pestle along with grain, yet his foolishness will not be removed from him.
author: Solomon

quote: Know well the state of your flocks, and pay attention to your herds:
author: Solomon

quote: for riches are not forever, nor does even the crown endure to all generations.
author: Solomon

quote: The hay is removed, and the new growth appears, the grasses of the hills are gathered in.
author: Solomon

quote: The lambs are for your clothing, and the goats are the price of a field.
author: Solomon

quote: There will be plenty of goats' milk for your food, for your family's food, and for the nourishment of your servant girls.
author: Solomon

quote: The wicked flee when no one pursues; but the righteous are as bold as a lion.
author: Solomon

quote: In rebellion, a land has many rulers, but order is maintained by a man of understanding and knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: A needy man who oppresses the poor is like a driving rain which leaves no crops.
author: Solomon

quote: Those who forsake the law praise the wicked; but those who keep the law contend with them.
author: Solomon

quote: Evil men don't understand justice; but those who seek Yahweh understand it fully.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is the poor who walks in his integrity, than he who is perverse in his ways, and he is rich.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever keeps the law is a wise son; but he who is a companion of gluttons shames his father.
author: Solomon

quote: He who increases his wealth by excessive interest gathers it for one who has pity on the poor.
author: Solomon

quote: He who turns away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer is an abomination.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever causes the upright to go astray in an evil way, he will fall into his own trap; but the blameless will inherit good.
author: Solomon

quote: The rich man is wise in his own eyes; but the poor who has understanding sees through him.
author: Solomon

quote: When the righteous triumph, there is great glory; but when the wicked rise, men hide themselves.
author: Solomon

quote: He who conceals his sins doesn't prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy.
author: Solomon

quote: Blessed is the man who always fears; but one who hardens his heart falls into trouble.
author: Solomon

quote: As a roaring lion or a charging bear, so is a wicked ruler over helpless people.
author: Solomon

quote: A tyrannical ruler lacks judgment. One who hates ill-gotten gain will have long days.
author: Solomon

quote: A man who is tormented by life blood will be a fugitive until death; no one will support him.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever walks blamelessly is kept safe; but one with perverse ways will fall suddenly.
author: Solomon

quote: One who works his land will have an abundance of food; but one who chases fantasies will have his fill of poverty.
author: Solomon

quote: A faithful man is rich with blessings; but one who is eager to be rich will not go unpunished.
author: Solomon

quote: To show partiality is not good; yet a man will do wrong for a piece of bread.
author: Solomon

quote: A stingy man hurries after riches, and doesn't know that poverty waits for him.
author: Solomon

quote: One who rebukes a man will afterward find more favor than one who flatters with the tongue.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever robs his father or his mother, and says, |It's not wrong.| He is a partner with a destroyer.
author: Solomon

quote: One who is greedy stirs up strife; but one who trusts in Yahweh will prosper.
author: Solomon

quote: One who trusts in himself is a fool; but one who walks in wisdom is kept safe.
author: Solomon

quote: One who gives to the poor has no lack; but one who closes his eyes will have many curses.
author: Solomon

quote: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves; but when they perish, the righteous thrive.
author: Solomon

quote: He who is often rebuked and stiffens his neck will be destroyed suddenly, with no remedy.
author: Solomon

quote: When the righteous thrive, the people rejoice; but when the wicked rule, the people groan.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever loves wisdom brings joy to his father; but a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth.
author: Solomon

quote: The king by justice makes the land stable, but he who takes bribes tears it down.
author: Solomon

quote: A man who flatters his neighbor spreads a net for his feet.
author: Solomon

quote: An evil man is snared by his sin, but the righteous can sing and be glad.
author: Solomon

quote: The righteous care about justice for the poor. The wicked aren't concerned about knowledge.
author: Solomon

quote: Mockers stir up a city, but wise men turn away anger.
author: Solomon

quote: If a wise man goes to court with a foolish man, the fool rages or scoffs, and there is no peace.
author: Solomon

quote: The bloodthirsty hate a man of integrity; and they seek the life of the upright.
author: Solomon

quote: A fool vents all of his anger, but a wise man brings himself under control.
author: Solomon

quote: If a ruler listens to lies, all of his officials are wicked.
author: Solomon

quote: The poor man and the oppressor have this in common: Yahweh gives sight to the eyes of both.
author: Solomon

quote: The king who fairly judges the poor, his throne shall be established forever.
author: Solomon

quote: The rod of correction gives wisdom, but a child left to himself causes shame to his mother.
author: Solomon

quote: When the wicked increase, sin increases; but the righteous will see their downfall.
author: Solomon

quote: Correct your son, and he will give you peace; yes, he will bring delight to your soul.
author: Solomon

quote: Where there is no revelation, the people cast off restraint; but one who keeps the law is blessed.
author: Solomon

quote: A servant can't be corrected by words. Though he understands, yet he will not respond.
author: Solomon

quote: Do you see a man who is hasty in his words? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
author: Solomon

quote: He who pampers his servant from youth will have him become a son in the end.
author: Solomon

quote: An angry man stirs up strife, and a wrathful man abounds in sin.
author: Solomon

quote: A man's pride brings him low, but one of lowly spirit gains honor.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever is an accomplice of a thief is an enemy of his own soul. He takes an oath, but dares not testify.
author: Solomon

quote: The fear of man proves to be a snare, but whoever puts his trust in Yahweh is kept safe.
author: Solomon

quote: Many seek the ruler's favor, but a man's justice comes from Yahweh.
author: Solomon

quote: A dishonest man detests the righteous, and the upright in their ways detest the wicked.
author: Solomon

quote: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, the oracle: the man says to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal:
author: Solomon

quote: |Surely I am the most ignorant man, and don't have a man's understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: I have not learned wisdom, neither do I have the knowledge of the Holy One.
author: Solomon

quote: Who has ascended up into heaven, and descended? Who has gathered the wind in his fists? Who has bound the waters in his garment? Who has established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and what is his son's name, if you know?
author: Solomon

quote: |Every word of God is flawless. He is a shield to those who take refuge in him.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't you add to his words, lest he reprove you, and you be found a liar.
author: Solomon

quote: |Two things I have asked of you; don't deny me before I die:
author: Solomon

quote: Remove far from me falsehood and lies. Give me neither poverty nor riches. Feed me with the food that is needful for me;
author: Solomon

quote: lest I be full, deny you, and say, 'Who is Yahweh?' or lest I be poor, and steal, and so dishonor the name of my God.
author: Solomon

quote: |Don't slander a servant to his master, lest he curse you, and you be held guilty.
author: Solomon

quote: There is a generation that curses their father, and doesn't bless their mother.
author: Solomon

quote: There is a generation that is pure in their own eyes, yet are not washed from their filthiness.
author: Solomon

quote: There is a generation, oh how lofty are their eyes! Their eyelids are lifted up.
author: Solomon

quote: There is a generation whose teeth are like swords, and their jaws like knives, to devour the poor from the earth, and the needy from among men.
author: Solomon

quote: |The leach has two daughters: 'Give, give.' |There are three things that are never satisfied; four that don't say, 'Enough:'
author: Solomon

quote: Sheol, the barren womb; the earth that is not satisfied with water; and the fire that doesn't say, 'Enough.'
author: Solomon

quote: |The eye that mocks at his father, and scorns obedience to his mother: the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, the young eagles shall eat it.
author: Solomon

quote: |There are three things which are too amazing for me, four which I don't understand:
author: Solomon

quote: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent on a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maiden.
author: Solomon

quote: |So is the way of an adulterous woman: she eats and wipes her mouth, and says, 'I have done nothing wrong.'
author: Solomon

quote: |For three things the earth tremble, and under four, it can't bear up:
author: Solomon

quote: For a servant when he is king; a fool when he is filled with food;
author: Solomon

quote: for an unloved woman when she is married; and a handmaid who is heir to her mistress.
author: Solomon

quote: |There are four things which are little on the earth, but they are exceedingly wise:
author: Solomon

quote: the ants are not a strong people, yet they provide their food in the summer.
author: Solomon

quote: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks.
author: Solomon

quote: The locusts have no king, yet they advance in ranks.
author: Solomon

quote: You can catch a lizard with your hands, yet it is in kings' palaces.
author: Solomon

quote: |There are three things which are stately in their march, four which are stately in going:
author: Solomon

quote: The lion, which is mightiest among animals, and doesn't turn away for any;
author: Solomon

quote: the greyhound, the male goat also; and the king against whom there is no rising up.
author: Solomon

quote: |If you have done foolishly in lifting up yourself, or if you have thought evil, put your hand over your mouth.
author: Solomon

quote: For as the churning of milk brings forth butter, and the wringing of the nose brings forth blood; so the forcing of wrath brings forth strife.|
author: Solomon

quote: The words of king Lemuel; the oracle which his mother taught him.
author: Solomon

quote: |Oh, my son! Oh, son of my womb! Oh, son of my vows!
author: Solomon

quote: Don't give your strength to women, nor your ways to that which destroys kings.
author: Solomon

quote: It is not for kings, Lemuel; it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes to say, 'Where is strong drink?'
author: Solomon

quote: lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the justice due to anyone who is afflicted.
author: Solomon

quote: Give strong drink to him who is ready to perish; and wine to the bitter in soul:
author: Solomon

quote: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
author: Solomon

quote: Open your mouth for the mute, in the cause of all who are left desolate.
author: Solomon

quote: Open your mouth, judge righteously, and serve justice to the poor and needy.|
author: Solomon

quote: Who can find a worthy woman? For her price is far above rubies.
author: Solomon

quote: The heart of her husband trusts in her. He shall have no lack of gain.
author: Solomon

quote: She does him good, and not harm, all the days of her life.
author: Solomon

quote: She seeks wool and flax, and works eagerly with her hands.
author: Solomon

quote: She is like the merchant ships. She brings her bread from afar.
author: Solomon

quote: She rises also while it is yet night, gives food to her household, and portions for her servant girls.
author: Solomon

quote: She considers a field, and buys it. With the fruit of her hands, she plants a vineyard.
author: Solomon

quote: She arms her waist with strength, and makes her arms strong.
author: Solomon

quote: She perceives that her merchandise is profitable. Her lamp doesn't go out by night.
author: Solomon

quote: She lays her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.
author: Solomon

quote: She opens her arms to the poor; yes, she extends her hands to the needy.
author: Solomon

quote: She is not afraid of the snow for her household; for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
author: Solomon

quote: She makes for herself carpets of tapestry. Her clothing is fine linen and purple.
author: Solomon

quote: Her husband is respected in the gates, when he sits among the elders of the land.
author: Solomon

quote: She makes linen garments and sells them, and delivers sashes to the merchant.
author: Solomon

quote: Strength and dignity are her clothing. She laughs at the time to come.
author: Solomon

quote: She opens her mouth with wisdom. Faithful instruction is on her tongue.
author: Solomon

quote: She looks well to the ways of her household, and doesn't eat the bread of idleness.
author: Solomon

quote: Her children rise up and call her blessed. Her husband also praises her:
author: Solomon

quote: |Many women do noble things, but you excel them all.|
author: Solomon

quote: Charm is deceitful, and beauty is vain; but a woman who fears Yahweh, she shall be praised.
author: Solomon

quote: Give her of the fruit of her hands! Let her works praise her in the gates!
author: Solomon
